words.definition: A group of people related by blood or marriage.
sentences: My **family** went on vacation together.
I love spending time with my **family**.
We are a very close-knit **family**.

words.definition: A mother and father.
sentences: My **parents** help me with my homework.
Always listen to your **parents**.
Her **parents** are very supportive.

words.definition: A female parent.
sentences: My **mother** bakes delicious cakes.
She is a caring **mother**.
I bought a gift for my **mother**.

words.definition: A male parent.
sentences: My **father** teaches me how to ride a bike.
He is a strong and supportive **father**.
I went fishing with my **father**.

words.definition: A young human being below the age of puberty.
sentences: The **child** played happily in the park.
Every **child** deserves a good education.
She is a very curious **child**.

words.definition: More than one child.
sentences: The park was full of laughing **children**.
She has three **children**.
All the **children** enjoyed the party.

words.definition: A boy or man in relation to his parents.
sentences: He is their only **son**.
My **son** loves playing video games.
The proud parents watched their **son** graduate.

words.definition: A girl or woman in relation to her parents.
sentences: Their **daughter** is a talented artist.
My **daughter** helps me in the kitchen.
She is a loving **daughter**.

words.definition: A boy or man who has one or both of the same parents as another.
sentences: My **brother** and I play soccer together.
He is my older **brother**.
Do you have a **brother** or sister?

words.definition: A girl or woman who has one or both of the same parents as another.
sentences: My **sister** helps me with my homework.
She is my younger **sister**.
I share a room with my **sister**.

words.definition: The parents of your mother or father.
sentences: I visit my **grandparents** every summer.
My **grandparents** tell great stories.
They love their **grandparents** very much.

words.definition: The mother of your mother or father.
sentences: My **grandmother** taught me how to knit.
She loves her **grandmother** very much.
My **grandmother** always has candy for me.

words.definition: The father of your mother or father.
sentences: My **grandfather** takes me fishing.
He respects his **grandfather** greatly.
My **grandfather** tells funny jokes.

words.definition: A child of one's son or daughter.
sentences: The old man adored his only **grandchild**.
She loves spending time with her **grandchildren**.
His **grandchild** brought him much joy.

words.definition: The son of one's son or daughter.
sentences: My **grandson** is learning to play the piano.
He is a proud **grandson**.
Her **grandson** visits every weekend.

words.definition: The daughter of one's son or daughter.
sentences: My **granddaughter** loves to draw.
She is a sweet **granddaughter**.
His **granddaughter** sent him a lovely card.

words.definition: The sister of your father or mother, or the wife of your uncle.
sentences: My **aunt** visited us last weekend.
She is my favorite **aunt**.
My **aunt** always brings me gifts.

words.definition: The brother of your father or mother, or the husband of your aunt.
sentences: My **uncle** took me to the zoo.
He is a funny **uncle**.
My **uncle** lives in another city.

words.definition: A child of your aunt or uncle.
sentences: My **cousin** is the same age as me.
We played games with our **cousins**.
She is my favorite **cousin**.

words.definition: The son of your brother or sister.
sentences: My **nephew** loves playing with cars.
He is a cute little **nephew**.
My sister's **nephew** is visiting.

words.definition: The daughter of your brother or sister.
sentences: My **niece** is learning to read.
She is a very clever **niece**.
My brother's **niece** loves drawing.

words.definition: A husband or wife.
sentences: He introduced his **spouse** at the party.
They have been loving **spouses** for many years.
Each **spouse** has equal rights.

words.definition: A married man.
sentences: My **husband** helps me around the house.
She loves her **husband** very much.
He is a devoted **husband** and father.

words.definition: A married woman.
sentences: His **wife** is a talented painter.
She is a supportive **wife**.
My **wife** and I enjoy cooking together.

words.definition: The legal union of two people as partners in a personal relationship.
sentences: They celebrated fifty years of **marriage**.
**Marriage** is a big commitment.
Their **marriage** is built on trust.

words.definition: A marriage ceremony, especially one with a religious or traditional service.
sentences: I went to my cousin's **wedding**.
The **wedding** was held in a beautiful garden.
She wore a white dress for her **wedding**.

words.definition: The legal ending of a marriage.
sentences: They decided to get a **divorce**.
**Divorce** can be a difficult time for families.
The lawyer handled their **divorce** case.

words.definition: Not married or in a long-term relationship.
sentences: She is a **single** mother raising two children.
He has been **single** for a few years.
Being **single** allows for more personal freedom.

words.definition: Having formally agreed to marry.
sentences: They got **engaged** last month.
She showed off her **engaged** ring.
The **engaged** couple is planning their wedding.

words.definition: A person's regular male companion with whom they have a romantic relationship.
sentences: She went to the movies with her **boyfriend**.
My sister introduced her new **boyfriend**.
He is a very kind **boyfriend**.

words.definition: A person's regular female companion with whom they have a romantic relationship.
sentences: He bought flowers for his **girlfriend**.
My brother's **girlfriend** is very friendly.
She is my best **girlfriend**.

words.definition: A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
sentences: My best **friend** lives next door.
It's good to have many **friends**.
She is a true **friend**.

words.definition: The state of being friends.
sentences: Their **friendship** has lasted for many years.
**Friendship** is built on trust and respect.
She values her **friendship** with him.

words.definition: The way in which two or more people or things are connected, or the state of being connected.
sentences: They have a strong **relationship**.
Communication is key in any **relationship**.
Their **relationship** grew stronger over time.

words.definition: An intense feeling of deep affection.
sentences: Parents have unconditional **love** for their children.
Their **love** for each other was evident.
I **love** my family very much.

words.definition: Firm belief in the reliability, truth, ability, or strength of someone or something.
sentences: **Trust** is essential in any relationship.
I have complete **trust** in my friend.
It takes time to build **trust**.

words.definition: A feeling of deep admiration for someone or something elicited by their abilities, qualities, or achievements.
sentences: Show **respect** to your elders.
Mutual **respect** is important in a family.
He earned the **respect** of his peers.

words.definition: To give assistance to someone or something.
sentences: My family always **supports** my decisions.
We offer each other emotional **support**.
Her friends **support** her dreams.

words.definition: The imparting or exchanging of information by speaking, writing, or using some other medium.
sentences: Good **communication** is vital in relationships.
We need to improve our **communication**.
Open **communication** helps resolve conflicts.

words.definition: A serious disagreement or argument.
sentences: They had a small **conflict** over a toy.
Try to resolve **conflict** peacefully.
The siblings often had **conflicts**.

words.definition: A reason or set of reasons given with the aim of persuading others that an action or idea is right or wrong.
sentences: They had a heated **argument** about politics.
Avoid unnecessary **arguments**.
The siblings had a minor **argument** over the TV remote.

words.definition: The act of forgiving or being forgiven.
sentences: **Forgiveness** is important for healing relationships.
She asked for **forgiveness** after her mistake.
Learning to practice **forgiveness** is a sign of maturity.

words.definition: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
sentences: Show **empathy** towards others' feelings.
Having **empathy** helps you connect with people.
She felt deep **empathy** for her friend's loss.

words.definition: Feelings of pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune.
sentences: I felt great **sympathy** for the grieving family.
She expressed her **sympathy** to her friend.
He offered his **sympathy** to the accident victims.

words.definition: A gentle feeling of fondness or liking.
sentences: He showed great **affection** for his grandchildren.
Their relationship is full of warmth and **affection**.
Pets often show their owners a lot of **affection**.

words.definition: The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.
sentences: Parents provide loving **care** for their children.
She takes great **care** of her elderly parents.
We need to show **care** for our friends.

words.definition: A strong connection or tie.
sentences: The siblings share a strong **bond**.
Their shared experiences created a special **bond**.
The mother and child formed an unbreakable **bond**.

words.definition: A relationship in which a person, thing, or idea is linked or associated with something else.
sentences: They felt an instant **connection** when they met.
Building a strong **connection** takes time.
The internet provides a global **connection**.

words.definition: Providing encouragement or emotional help.
sentences: My parents are very **supportive** of my dreams.
She has a **supportive** group of friends.
Being **supportive** helps others feel valued.

words.definition: The quality of being friendly, generous, and considerate.
sentences: Show **kindness** to everyone you meet.
Her act of **kindness** brightened my day.
Small acts of **kindness** can make a big impact.

words.definition: The quality of being kind and giving.
sentences: His **generosity** is well-known.
The family showed great **generosity** to the needy.
Her **generosity** touched many hearts.

words.definition: The capacity to accept or tolerate delay, trouble, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious.
sentences: Teaching children requires a lot of **patience**.
Have **patience** when learning a new skill.
Her **patience** was tested by the long wait.

words.definition: The ability to understand something; comprehension.
sentences: He showed great **understanding** of her situation.
Mutual **understanding** is key to a good relationship.
She has a deep **understanding** of human emotions.

words.definition: A strong feeling of support or allegiance.
sentences: Dogs are known for their **loyalty**.
He showed great **loyalty** to his friends.
**Loyalty** is a valuable trait in any relationship.

words.definition: The state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, or person.
sentences: Marriage requires strong **commitment** from both partners.
He showed great **commitment** to his family.
Her **commitment** to her studies paid off.

words.definition: The state or fact of having a duty to deal with something or of having control over someone.
sentences: Taking care of pets is a big **responsibility**.
He showed great **responsibility** by completing his tasks.
Parents have a huge **responsibility** towards their children.

words.definition: A moral or legal obligation; a responsibility.
sentences: It's my **duty** to help my younger siblings.
He performed his **duty** as a father.
Citizens have a **duty** to vote.

words.definition: A natural liking for and understanding of someone or something.
sentences: They shared a natural **affinity** for music.
She felt an immediate **affinity** with her new friend.
His **affinity** for animals was clear.

words.definition: The state of being in agreement or concord.
sentences: The family lived in perfect **harmony**.
They strive for **harmony** in their relationships.
Peace and **harmony** are important in a home.

words.definition: The action or process of working together to the same end.
sentences: Family members need to show **cooperation**.
Their project succeeded due to good **cooperation**.
**Cooperation** makes tasks easier.

words.definition: The state of being a parent.
sentences: **Parenthood** brings many joys and challenges.
They embraced the responsibilities of **parenthood**.
The book offers advice on modern **parenthood**.

words.definition: Each of two or more children of whom one or both parents are the same; a brother or sister.
sentences: She has two **siblings**.
The **sibling** bond is often very strong.
They had a typical **sibling** rivalry.

words.definition: One's family and relations.
sentences: All her **kin** gathered for the celebration.
He has many close **kin** in the village.
We are all distant **kin**.

words.definition: A person connected by blood or marriage.
sentences: Many of my **relatives** live in another state.
She is a distant **relative** of mine.
We invited all our **relatives** to the party.

words.definition: A person, typically one more remote than a grandparent, from whom one is descended.
sentences: We learned about our **ancestors** in history class.
My **ancestors** came from a different country.
He traced his family tree back to his **ancestors**.

words.definition: A person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.
sentences: The family reunion brought together many **descendants**.
He is a direct **descendant** of the founder.
We are the **descendants** of ancient tribes.

words.definition: All of the people born and living at about the same time.
sentences: Three **generations** of our family live in this house.
The younger **generation** has different ideas.
This technology will benefit future **generations**.

words.definition: A house and its occupants regarded as a unit.
sentences: The average **household** size has changed over time.
She manages the entire **household**.
Many **households** now have internet access.

words.definition: Relating to the running of a home or to family relations.
sentences: They share **domestic** duties equally.
She enjoys **domestic** life.
The debate was about **domestic** policy.

words.definition: The treatment and training of a child during childhood.
sentences: He had a strict **upbringing**.
Her happy **upbringing** shaped her personality.
A good **upbringing** provides a strong foundation.

words.definition: To care for and encourage the growth or development of.
sentences: Parents should **nurture** their children's talents.
It's important to **nurture** friendships.
The teacher helped **nurture** the student's creativity.

words.definition: To encourage or promote the development of something.
sentences: The school aims to **foster** a sense of community.
They decided to **foster** a child in need.
Reading helps **foster** imagination.

words.definition: To legally take another's child and bring it up as one's own.
sentences: They decided to **adopt** a child.
Many families choose to **adopt**.
The couple hopes to **adopt** a baby soon.

words.definition: The legal process of taking another's child and bringing it up as one's own.
sentences: The **adoption** process can be long.
She learned about her **adoption** when she was older.
They celebrated the finalization of their **adoption**.

words.definition: The parents from whom a person is genetically descended.
sentences: She searched for her **biological parents**.
Your **biological parents** are your birth parents.
Some adopted children want to meet their **biological parents**.

words.definition: Parents who have adopted a child.
sentences: Her **adoptive parents** raised her with love.
The child bonded quickly with her **adoptive parents**.
They became wonderful **adoptive parents**.

words.definition: The husband of one's mother and not one's biological father.
sentences: My **stepfather** is very kind to me.
She has a good relationship with her **stepfather**.
My mom married my **stepfather** last year.

words.definition: The wife of one's father and not one's biological mother.
sentences: His **stepmother** helps him with his homework.
She has a new **stepmother**.
My dad married my **stepmother** recently.

words.definition: A child of one's stepmother or stepfather.
sentences: I enjoy playing with my **stepsiblings**.
She gained two **stepsiblings** when her parents remarried.
My **stepsibling** is older than me.

words.definition: A brother with whom one shares only one parent.
sentences: My **half-brother** lives in another city.
He has a younger **half-brother**.
They share the same mother, so he's her **half-brother**.

words.definition: A sister with whom one shares only one parent.
sentences: She visits her **half-sister** every holiday.
My dad's daughter is my **half-sister**.
They have different fathers, so she's her **half-sister**.

words.definition: The relatives of one's husband or wife.
sentences: We are visiting my **in-laws** next weekend.
She has a good relationship with her **in-laws**.
My husband's parents are my **in-laws**.

words.definition: The mother of one's husband or wife.
sentences: My **mother-in-law** is a great cook.
She gets along well with her **mother-in-law**.
His **mother-in-law** visited for the holidays.

words.definition: The father of one's husband or wife.
sentences: My **father-in-law** is a retired engineer.
He respects his **father-in-law** very much.
Her **father-in-law** gave a speech at the wedding.

words.definition: The brother of one's husband or wife, or the husband of one's sister.
sentences: My **brother-in-law** helped me move furniture.
She went hiking with her **brother-in-law**.
My sister's husband is my **brother-in-law**.

words.definition: The sister of one's husband or wife, or the wife of one's brother.
sentences: My **sister-in-law** is a doctor.
He gets along well with his **sister-in-law**.
My brother's wife is my **sister-in-law**.

words.definition: A family that extends beyond the nuclear family, including grandparents, aunts, uncles, and other relatives.
sentences: We have a large **extended family**.
Our family reunions include all our **extended family**.
Living near your **extended family** can be very supportive.

words.definition: A couple and their dependent children, regarded as a basic social unit.
sentences: The traditional **nuclear family** consists of parents and children.
My immediate **nuclear family** includes my parents and siblings.
The study focused on the dynamics of the **nuclear family**.

words.definition: A family consisting of a couple and their children from previous relationships and/or their own children.
sentences: They formed a happy **blended family**.
Adjusting to a **blended family** can take time.
Our **blended family** enjoys spending holidays together.

words.definition: A family in which a child or children live with one parent.
sentences: She manages a busy **single-parent family**.
Many children grow up in a **single-parent family**.
Support systems are important for a **single-parent family**.

words.definition: A person who is legally responsible for the care of someone who is unable to manage their own affairs, especially a child whose parents have died or are absent.
sentences: Her aunt became her legal **guardian**.
The court appointed a **guardian** for the child.
A **guardian** has important responsibilities.

words.definition: A person who provides direct care for another person, especially a child, elderly person, or sick person.
sentences: She is a dedicated **caregiver** for her grandmother.
Many families rely on professional **caregivers**.
Being a **caregiver** can be challenging but rewarding.

words.definition: People who rely on another person for financial support.
sentences: He has several **dependents** to support.
The insurance policy covers his **dependents**.
Children are usually considered **dependents** until adulthood.

words.definition: Routine tasks done in and around the house.
sentences: We all help with the **household chores**.
Doing **household chores** teaches responsibility.
My favorite **household chore** is washing dishes.

words.definition: Moral and ethical principles traditionally upheld and transmitted within a family.
sentences: They instilled strong **family values** in their children.
Respect and honesty are important **family values**.
Our **family values** guide our decisions.

words.definition: The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation.
sentences: Celebrating holidays is a family **tradition**.
We have many old family **traditions**.
It's a long-standing **tradition** in our culture.

words.definition: A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something specific to a particular society, place, or time.
sentences: It's a local **custom** to exchange gifts.
Every family has its own unique **customs**.
Learning about different cultural **customs** is interesting.

words.definition: A religious or solemn ceremony consisting of a series of actions performed according to a prescribed order.
sentences: Our family has a nightly reading **ritual**.
The wedding ceremony included ancient **rituals**.
Morning coffee is a daily **ritual** for him.

words.definition: Property that is or may be inherited; an inheritance.
sentences: We are proud of our cultural **heritage**.
The old building is part of the city's **heritage**.
Learning about your family's **heritage** is fascinating.

words.definition: One's family or ethnic descent.
sentences: He traced his **ancestry** back to Ireland.
Learning about your **ancestry** can be very interesting.
Her diverse **ancestry** includes several European countries.

words.definition: The study and tracing of lines of descent or development from the earliest form.
sentences: She is passionate about studying **genealogy**.
Online resources make **genealogy** research easier.
His hobby is tracing his family's **genealogy**.

words.definition: A diagram showing the relationship between people in several generations of a family.
sentences: We drew our **family tree** for a school project.
The old book contained a detailed **family tree**.
Creating a **family tree** helps you understand your ancestors.

words.definition: A gathering of people who have been separated for some time.
sentences: We had a big family **reunion** last summer.
The school organized a class **reunion**.
The annual **reunion** is always fun.

words.definition: A meeting or assembly of people.
sentences: The family had a small **gathering** for dinner.
It was a joyful **gathering** of friends.
The community held a public **gathering**.

words.definition: The action of celebrating an important day or event.
sentences: The wedding was a grand **celebration**.
We had a small **celebration** for her birthday.
The town held a big **celebration** after the victory.

words.definition: The date on which an event took place in a previous year.
sentences: They celebrated their tenth wedding **anniversary**.
My parents' **anniversary** is next month.
It's the **anniversary** of the school's founding.

words.definition: The anniversary of the day on which a person was born.
sentences: I'm planning a party for my **birthday**.
Happy **birthday** to you!
Her **birthday** is in December.

words.definition: A day of festivity or recreation when no work is done.
sentences: We celebrate many **holidays** with family.
My favorite **holiday** is Christmas.
We are going on **holiday** next week.

words.definition: An extended period of leisure and recreation, especially one spent away from home or in traveling.
sentences: We went on a family **vacation** to the beach.
I'm looking forward to my summer **vacation**.
They planned a long **vacation** abroad.

words.definition: The place where one lives permanently, especially as a member of a family or household.
sentences: There's no place like **home**.
I love coming **home** after a long day.
They built a new **home** for their family.

words.definition: A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people.
sentences: Their **house** has a big garden.
We bought a new **house** last year.
The old **house** needs repairs.

words.definition: A set of rooms forming a separate residence within a house or block of apartments.
sentences: They live in a small **apartment** in the city.
My friend's **apartment** is on the third floor.
Finding an affordable **apartment** can be hard.

words.definition: A district, especially one forming a community within a town or city.
sentences: Our **neighborhood** is very friendly.
She grew up in this **neighborhood**.
The park is in our **neighborhood**.

words.definition: A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.
sentences: The school is an important part of the local **community**.
We organized a clean-up event for the **community**.
Building a strong sense of **community** is vital.

words.definition: A person living next door to or very near to the speaker or person referred to.
sentences: Our new **neighbor** is very friendly.
I borrowed some sugar from my **neighbor**.
He helped his elderly **neighbor** with groceries.

words.definition: A person one knows slightly, but who is not a close friend.
sentences: He is an old **acquaintance** from college.
She has many casual **acquaintances**.
I only know him as an **acquaintance**.

words.definition: A person with whom one works in a profession or business.
sentences: My **colleague** helped me with the project.
She respects her **colleagues**.
He had lunch with his **colleagues**.

words.definition: An experienced and trusted adviser.
sentences: My teacher was a great **mentor** to me.
He found a **mentor** to guide his career.
A good **mentor** provides support and advice.

words.definition: A person who is advised, trained, or guided by a mentor.
sentences: The mentor guided her **mentee** through the project.
As a **mentee**, she learned a lot from her senior.
The program pairs experienced professionals with young **mentees**.

words.definition: A person who takes part in an undertaking with another or others, especially in a business or company with shared risks and profits.
sentences: They are business **partners**.
She danced with her **partner**.
He introduced his life **partner**.

words.definition: A person with whom one is allied or associated in business or a profession.
sentences: He is a junior **associate** at the law firm.
She met with her business **associates**.
They are close **associates** in the project.

words.definition: A person of the same age, status, or ability as another.
sentences: Students often learn from their **peers**.
He asked his **peer** for help with the homework.
**Peer** pressure can be strong among teenagers.

words.definition: An interconnected group or system.
sentences: Building a professional **network** is important for your career.
She has a wide **network** of friends and colleagues.
Social media helps people expand their **network**.

words.definition: The activity of mixing socially with others.
sentences: He enjoys **socializing** with his friends on weekends.
**Socializing** is important for mental well-being.
She spent the evening **socializing** at the party.

words.definition: Reciprocal action or influence.
sentences: Positive **interaction** is key in group work.
Human **interaction** is important for development.
The game encourages player **interaction**.

words.definition: Abilities in expressing and understanding information.
sentences: Good **communication skills** are vital for relationships.
She improved her **communication skills** by practicing.
Developing strong **communication skills** helps in all aspects of life.

words.definition: A way of listening and responding to another person that improves mutual understanding.
sentences: Practice **active listening** to truly understand others.
**Active listening** helps build stronger relationships.
The counselor taught her clients about **active listening**.

words.definition: Communication without words, using body language, facial expressions, etc.
sentences: Body language is a form of **non-verbal communication**.
He understood her through her **non-verbal communication**.
**Non-verbal communication** can convey a lot of meaning.

words.definition: Communication through spoken words.
sentences: Speaking clearly is important for effective **verbal communication**.
They had a direct **verbal communication** about the issue.
**Verbal communication** allows for immediate feedback.

words.definition: The process of communicating nonverbally through conscious or unconscious gestures and movements.
sentences: Her **body language** showed she was nervous.
Understanding **body language** can help you read people.
He paid attention to his friend's **body language**.

words.definition: A gesture executed with the facial muscles.
sentences: Her happy **facial expression** brightened the room.
His **facial expression** showed surprise.
A smile is a universal **facial expression** of happiness.

words.definition: The quality or character of a person's voice, indicating their mood or attitude.
sentences: Her **tone of voice** was very gentle.
His angry **tone of voice** made me upset.
Pay attention to the **tone of voice** when talking.

words.definition: Sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others.
sentences: She showed great **compassion** for the homeless.
His **compassion** for animals was evident.
Acts of **compassion** make the world a better place.

words.definition: The ability or willingness to tolerate the existence of opinions or behavior that one dislikes or disagrees with.
sentences: Promote **tolerance** and understanding among diverse groups.
He showed great **tolerance** for different viewpoints.
Religious **tolerance** is important in a diverse society.

words.definition: The action of consenting to receive or undertake something offered.
sentences: Finding **acceptance** in a group is important.
She felt a sense of **acceptance** in her new community.
Self-**acceptance** is key to happiness.

words.definition: The practice or policy of providing equal access to opportunities and resources for people who might otherwise be excluded.
sentences: The school promotes **inclusion** for students with special needs.
True **inclusion** means everyone feels welcome.
We aim for full **inclusion** in all school activities.

words.definition: The state of being diverse; variety.
sentences: Our school celebrates cultural **diversity**.
Embracing **diversity** enriches the community.
The team benefits from the **diversity** of its members.

words.definition: An affinity for a place or situation.
sentences: She felt a strong sense of **belonging** in her new club.
Creating a sense of **belonging** is important for children.
Everyone wants to feel a sense of **belonging**.

words.definition: The formation of a close relationship, especially through shared experiences.
sentences: Family trips are great for **bonding**.
The team spent time together for **bonding** activities.
Early childhood experiences are important for parent-child **bonding**.

words.definition: A strong emotional bond or connection.
sentences: Babies form a strong **attachment** to their primary caregivers.
She developed a deep **attachment** to her pet.
Healthy **attachment** is important for emotional development.

words.definition: The state or process of affiliating or being affiliated.
sentences: He has a strong **affiliation** with his college.
Her political **affiliation** is well-known.
The club requires an annual **affiliation** fee.

words.definition: Blood relationship.
sentences: The tribe shared strong ties of **kinship**.
There's a sense of **kinship** among people from the same town.
The study explored patterns of **kinship** in ancient societies.

words.definition: Of, belonging to, or inherited from an ancestor or ancestors.
sentences: They visited their **ancestral** home.
The land has been in their **ancestral** family for generations.
He felt a strong connection to his **ancestral** roots.

words.definition: A person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor.
sentences: She is a direct **descendant** of a famous historical figure.
His **descendants** continue to live in the same village.
Are you a **descendant** of royalty?

words.definition: Descent from an ancestor; ancestry or pedigree.
sentences: She comes from a long **lineage** of artists.
His royal **lineage** was well-known.
The family traced their **lineage** back centuries.

words.definition: Differences in attitudes or behavior between young and older people.
sentences: There is often a **generation gap** in musical tastes.
The **generation gap** can lead to misunderstandings.
Bridging the **generation gap** requires open communication.

words.definition: Relating to or occurring between different generations.
sentences: The program encourages **intergenerational** activities.
There's often **intergenerational** learning in families.
The project aims to foster **intergenerational** understanding.

words.definition: The activity of bringing up a child.
sentences: Good **parenting** involves patience and love.
They attended a workshop on positive **parenting**.
**Parenting** styles vary across cultures.

words.definition: The process of bringing up a child.
sentences: **Child-rearing** practices differ around the world.
The book offers advice on effective **child-rearing**.
She found **child-rearing** to be both challenging and rewarding.

words.definition: The sharing of parenting responsibilities by two parents, typically after separation or divorce.
sentences: They successfully managed **co-parenting** after their divorce.
Effective **co-parenting** focuses on the child's well-being.
The parents worked together on a **co-parenting** plan.

words.definition: The protective care or guardianship of someone or something.
sentences: The parents shared joint **custody** of the children.
The court granted her full **custody**.
They went to court to decide child **custody**.

words.definition: The act of visiting, especially officially or as a tourist.
sentences: The court granted the father regular **visitation** rights.
She has weekly **visitation** with her children.
The judge set the terms of the **visitation** schedule.

words.definition: Financial support that a person is ordered by a court to give to their spouse after separation or divorce.
sentences: He was ordered to pay **alimony** to his former wife.
The amount of **alimony** was decided by the judge.
**Alimony** payments can be a source of conflict.

words.definition: Financial support for a child or children, paid by a parent who does not live with the child or children.
sentences: The court ordered him to pay **child support**.
**Child support** ensures the child's needs are met.
She receives **child support** payments monthly.

words.definition: A court of law that deals with family matters, such as divorce, child custody, and domestic violence.
sentences: They had to go to **family court** to resolve their dispute.
The **family court** aims to protect children's interests.
She hired a lawyer specializing in **family court** cases.

words.definition: Violent or aggressive behavior within the home, typically involving the violent abuse of a spouse or partner.
sentences: The shelter provides support for victims of **domestic violence**.
Awareness campaigns aim to stop **domestic violence**.
Reporting **domestic violence** is crucial for safety.

words.definition: The improper use of something; misuse.
sentences: Child **abuse** is a serious crime.
He suffered from emotional **abuse**.
Report any signs of **abuse** immediately.

words.definition: The state of being uncared for.
sentences: The old house showed signs of **neglect**.
Child **neglect** can have serious consequences.
He was accused of animal **neglect**.

words.definition: A system in which a minor has been placed into a ward, group home, or private home of a state-certified caregiver, referred to as a 'foster parent' or 'foster family'.
sentences: The child was placed in **foster care**.
Many children in **foster care** need loving homes.
She became a **foster care** parent.

words.definition: An organization that arranges adoptions.
sentences: They contacted an **adoption agency** to start the process.
The **adoption agency** provides support to families.
She works for a non-profit **adoption agency**.

words.definition: A type of therapy that helps family members improve communication and resolve conflicts.
sentences: They attended **family counseling** to work through their issues.
**Family counseling** can strengthen relationships.
The therapist specializes in **family counseling**.

words.definition: A type of therapy that helps couples improve their relationship.
sentences: They decided to try **marriage counseling**.
**Marriage counseling** can help couples communicate better.
The therapist offers **marriage counseling** sessions.

words.definition: A group of people with common experiences or concerns who provide emotional and practical support to one another.
sentences: She joined a **support group** for new mothers.
**Support groups** can be very helpful during difficult times.
He found comfort in his **support group**.

words.definition: The comfort, assistance, and information that people receive from others.
sentences: Having a strong **social support** network is crucial for well-being.
She relied on her **social support** during her illness.
Family and friends provide important **social support**.

words.definition: Comfort, reassurance, and a sense of belonging received from others.
sentences: He provided great **emotional support** to his grieving friend.
Children need strong **emotional support** from their parents.
Receiving **emotional support** helps in coping with stress.

words.definition: The process of resolving disputes or disagreements.
sentences: Learning **conflict resolution** skills is important for relationships.
They used mediation for **conflict resolution**.
Effective **conflict resolution** leads to stronger bonds.

words.definition: Intervention in a dispute in order to resolve it; arbitration.
sentences: They opted for **mediation** to settle their differences.
The mediator helped with the **mediation** process.
**Mediation** can help avoid court battles.

words.definition: Discussion aimed at reaching an agreement.
sentences: Successful **negotiation** requires flexibility.
They entered into **negotiation** to resolve the dispute.
The terms of the agreement were reached after long **negotiations**.

words.definition: An agreement or a settlement of a dispute that is reached by each side making concessions.
sentences: They reached a **compromise** on where to go for dinner.
In a good relationship, both sides should be willing to **compromise**.
Finding a **compromise** can be difficult but rewarding.

words.definition: A line that marks the limits of an area; a dividing line.
sentences: Setting healthy **boundaries** is important in relationships.
Respect personal **boundaries**.
Clear **boundaries** help maintain healthy relationships.

words.definition: A state in which one is not observed or disturbed by other people.
sentences: Everyone needs personal **privacy**.
Respecting others' **privacy** is important.
She values her **privacy** very much.

words.definition: The physical space immediately surrounding someone, into which any encroachment feels threatening or uncomfortable.
sentences: Respecting **personal space** is important in interactions.
He felt uncomfortable when his **personal space** was invaded.
Give people enough **personal space**.

words.definition: The quality of being able to be relied on as honest or truthful.
sentences: His **trustworthiness** is unquestionable.
Building **trustworthiness** takes time and consistent actions.
She values **trustworthiness** in her friends.

words.definition: The quality of being trustworthy or of performing consistently well.
sentences: His **reliability** makes him a great friend.
The car's **reliability** is excellent.
Demonstrate **reliability** by keeping your promises.

words.definition: The quality of being trustworthy and reliable.
sentences: Her **dependability** makes her a valuable team member.
He values **dependability** in his friends.
The project needs someone with high **dependability**.

words.definition: The quality of being honest.
sentences: Always practice **honesty** in your relationships.
Her **honesty** was appreciated.
**Honesty** is the best policy.

words.definition: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
sentences: He is a person of great **integrity**.
Maintaining **integrity** is crucial in all aspects of life.
Her **integrity** was never questioned.

words.definition: Feeling or showing deference and regard.
sentences: Be **respectful** to your elders.
He is always **respectful** towards others' opinions.
A **respectful** attitude fosters good relationships.

words.definition: Careful not to inconvenience or harm others.
sentences: She is a very **considerate** friend.
It was **considerate** of him to offer help.
Being **considerate** makes you a good person.

words.definition: Showing consideration for the needs of other people.
sentences: It was very **thoughtful** of you to send flowers.
He is a kind and **thoughtful** person.
Her **thoughtful** gesture made me smile.

words.definition: Showing an ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
sentences: An **empathetic** listener can truly connect with others.
She is very **empathetic** towards her friends.
Being **empathethic** helps in resolving conflicts.

words.definition: Able to accept or tolerate delays, problems, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious.
sentences: Parents need to be **patient** with their children.
He is a very **patient** teacher.
Being **patient** helps you achieve your goals.

words.definition: Sympathetic awareness or tolerance.
sentences: She has a deep **understanding** of human nature.
Show **understanding** when someone makes a mistake.
Their relationship is based on mutual **understanding**.

words.definition: Ready and willing to forgive.
sentences: Being **forgiving** is a sign of strength.
She has a very **forgiving** nature.
A **forgiving** heart brings peace.

words.definition: Displaying kindness and concern for others.
sentences: She is a very **caring** person.
The nurse was very **caring** towards the patients.
Being **caring** makes a big difference in relationships.

words.definition: Feeling or showing love or great care.
sentences: They have a very **loving** family.
She is a **loving** mother.
He gave her a **loving** hug.

words.definition: Readily feeling or showing fondness or tenderness.
sentences: He is a very **affectionate** child.
Their dog is very **affectionate**.
She gave him an **affectionate** pat on the arm.

words.definition: Bound together by strong relationships and common interests.
sentences: We are a very **close-knit** family.
The small community is very **close-knit**.
They have a **close-knit** group of friends.

words.definition: Having members who are closely bound together, typically by ties of family or friendship.
sentences: The village has a **tight-knit** community.
They are a **tight-knit** team.
Her family is very **tight-knit**.

words.definition: Not operating normally or properly.
sentences: Some families can be **dysfunctional**.
They sought therapy for their **dysfunctional** family patterns.
A **dysfunctional** relationship can cause stress.
